citation.title: SARS-CoV-2 titers in wastewater foreshadow dynamics and clinical presentation of new COVID-19 cases

news.title: Scientists are studying poop to understand how COVID-19 spreads
news.summary: LONDON — Poop doesn’t lie. That’s why scientists are looking at sewers running under the world’s cities and towns for information they hope will help to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

news.title: Coronavirus Pandemic Jumpstarts Wastewater-Based Epidemiology
news.summary: NEW YORK – Like performing one giant pooling test, assessing sewage for SARS-CoV-2 has the potential to localize hotspots of COVID-19 infection.

news.title: The Best COVID Warning System? Poop and Pooled Spit, Says One Colorado School
news.summary: Emerging research suggests infected people start shedding the coronavirus in their poop early in their infection, and possibly days before they begin shedding it from their mouths and noses.

news.title: The best COVID warning system? Poop and pooled spit, says one Colorado school
